email.title: Weekly Digest

image.alt: Four yellow macaroons in a horizontal line
image.title: Here's to hoping our weather will be as bright as those macaroons over the coming weeks!

email.text:
Welcome back to your weekly digest email!
First off, congratulations to those who have just finished with their exams! Although Imperial won't give us our much-deserved break just yet, we have lots planned over the next few weeks of term so you can relax, make the most out of your downtime and take your mind off exam results.
Over the next week, we'll be hosting a Game of Thrones finale viewing (**with pizza, tomorrow!**), an end of exams bar night and our annual international trip (this time, to Prague). More events follow, including our annual End of Year Dinner (location to be revealed soon!). Read on for more!
email.heading: Merch Update
email.text: If you still haven't collected your merchandise, be sure to give us an email at docsoc@imperial.ac.uk with your order details and preferred collection times and we will be in touch shortly.
email.heading: EmpireCTF - Weekly CTF Sessions
email.text:
Hello everyone!
**We are EmpireCTF, the Imperial CTF team, currently ranking second in the UK.** Capture The Flag is a type of cybersecurity competitions that covers a large range of topics including (but not limited to) web security, forensics, reverse engineering, binary exploitation, cryptography, and blockchain security.
Last term we have organized CTF dojo sessions every Wednesday led by Aurel – we hope you’ve enjoyed it. This term, we are going to cover reverse engineering and binary exploitation. You might be familiar with reverse engineering if you have done the bomb lab in the architecture course before; you might also want to learn about binary exploitation if you are interested in how a C program with buffer overflow can be hacked. These are all very interesting topics and I hope to see you on Wednesday!
If this piqued your interest, please join our Facebook group where we will announce the room and times for our weekly session: https://www.facebook.com/groups/2422843637940223/
– EmpireCTF
email.heading: Global Female Leadership Conference
email.text:
The Global Female Leadership Conference, **the largest university-led conference on female leadership in the world** is taking place on the 22nd of May at Oxford University’s Said Business School.
The conference will focus on the experiences and insights of inspiring female leaders from a wide variety of sectors and the challenges they have faced whilst showcasing their great accomplishments. A key theme will be the discussion of obstacles those identifying as women face in environments where they are underrepresented, which can make a career progression more challenging, as well as the questions about how to best combine prosperous careers with families and personal lives.
The organisers are very keen on having the students from this department attend and have offered a 50% discount on tickets - so they would cost less than £5. The discount code is VIPTICKET19.
More details, including a line-up of speakers can be found on the Eventbrite event page: https://www.eventbrite.co.uk/e/global-female-leadership-conference-2019-tickets-61647939647
email.heading: Hopperx1 Women in Computing Celebration
email.text:
[AnitaB.org](https://anitab.org/) offers an excellent opportunity for undergraduate and post-graduate students to attend a one-day locally organised event modeled after [Grace Hopper Celebration (GHC)](https://ghc.anitab.org/), the world’s largest gathering of women technologists. GHC is an immersive event bringing together women technologists at all levels – along with leading companies from industry, academia, and research – to build relationships, learn, and advance their careers.
[Hopperx1 London](https://community.anitab.org/event/hopperx1-london/) is taking place on the **14th of June**, at **ETC - 155 Bishopsgate, Liverpool Street, London**.
Scholars who attend Hopperx1 London gain access to career workshops, networking opportunities, and memories that will last a lifetime.
The Hopperx1 London program includes keynote speakers such as - Brenda Darden-Wilkson CEO & President of AnitaB.org, Mico Yuk Co-Founder/CEO of BI Brainz, panel discussions, as well as workshops and talks by inspiring women from our London WiT community, which will be split into Career, Data Science and AI, Emerging Technology and Open Source tracks.
The scholarship is a £75 Hopperx1 student registration fee and will be granted according to eligibility (see application form) and first come first served basis.
[AnitaB.org Hopper x 1 London Student Registration Scholarship Application Form](https://forms.gle/Q98sUDYAb66ktxGv8)
email.heading: DoCSoc Watches The Game of Thrones Finale With Liquidnet

event.text:
No matter whether you've loved this season or hated it, join us in viewing and reacting to the finale of one the biggest and most popular TV shows to ever air, Game of Thrones! Drinks and snacks will be provided (including pizza!), but you'll want to bring your own tissues. If you have any specific dietary requirements, please let us know as soon as possible by sending us an email.
This event is kindly sponsored by Liquidnet, who currently have graduate positions for Quantitative Developers/Data Scientists open! For more information about the roles, click here: https://bit.ly/2YoxM4t and read more about Liquidnet below.
"For 17 years, Liquidnet has revolutionized the way the world invests. Spanning 45 markets across the globe, our network connects the world’s biggest investors to the world’s biggest investment opportunities. We’re bold. We’re creative. We’re growing.
And we’re passionate about the power of technology to change the lives of our customers and the world beyond.
Liquidnet prides itself on standing at the nexus of Wall Street and Silicon Valley. But, with fewer than 500 employees, Liquidnet is more like a start-up than any dusty old bank or overgrown tech giant. It’s a culture where everyone has an opportunity to make a difference — and to make someone’s day a little brighter.
We’re looking for people who are smart, accomplished, and one of the friendliest people in the room. If that describes you, we’d love to talk to you about working with us."

email.heading: The Ramji-Bonardi End Of Exams Bar Night

event.text:
Exams are soon over, so come along to celebrate (or drown your sorrows) on Thursday 23rd May at Metric! Kick off summer term the right way, and don't miss out on what's sure to be a great night.
We're also dedicating this bar night to Inara Ramji and Alessandro Bonardi, the President and Vice President of DoCSoc.
Drinks tokens will be given upon entry for FREE to DoCSoc members. Tokens are valid for both alcoholic and non-alcoholic drinks. We have the right to refuse tokens to members at our discretion.
Please note: Drinks are not allowed to be taken outside Metric and we have the right to stop members from doing so.
You are entitled to bring one non-Imperial plus one. Please message/email DoCSoc with your plus one's name. The deadline to do this is BY 22nd May 10pm.
Any plus ones whose name has not been provided beforehand will not be let in!
College ID of your plus one must be shown at entry. You must stay with your plus one at all times and they will not be given any drinks tokens. Imperial plus ones must be DoCSoc members in order to attend.

email.heading: Facebook Cyber Security - Decoded Summer 2019
email.text:
\ Are you interested in cyber security? Join Facebook's Product Security team at our London offices for an evening of networking and talks about security here at Facebook.
Facebook's London Product Security team or PSAA is part of a global team who are focused on discovering potential weaknesses and then crafting creative solutions to eliminate those weaknesses. We achieve this by doing security reviews, code and design reviews, building tools and automations through our WhiteHat program. The team is spread across three offices, Menlo Park, Seattle and London and works cross functionally with software development teams. Testing code for vulnerabilities building out longtime security tools and protecting against anomalies or vulnerabilities. We aim to make life hard for the bad guys!
Our security team are focused on making Facebook a safe and secure place for the 2 billion people on our service to connect and share with each other. We're fortunate to have some of the brightest security minds at Facebook, and they are working around the clock to help protect people's Facebook accounts.
**When: 12th June**\ **Where: Facebook London Offices**
If you are interested in attending the event, please follow this [LINK](https://facebookdecodedsummer2019.splashthat.com/) and **submit your details by the 20th May**.
All applications will then be reviewed and decisions communicated by the 27th May.
